q_text: when was the northridge california earthquake
psg_text: The Northridge Earthquake. On the morning of Jan. 17, 1994, a 6.7 magnitude earthquake centered in Northridge hit the Los Angeles area, collapsing several buildings, destroying stretches of freeways, and sparking several fires in the area. At final count, the quake resulted in at least 57 deaths and rendered about 125,000 people homeless.

On the morning of Jan. 17, 1994, a 6.7 magnitude earthquake centered in Northridge hit the Los Angeles area, collapsing several buildings, destroying stretches of freeways, and sparking several fires in the area. q_text: what types of earthquake waves usually cause the most destruction?
psg_text: Surface waves, in contrast to body waves can only move along the surface. They arrive after the main P and S waves and are confined to the outer layers of the Earth. They cause the most surface destruction. Earthquake surface waves are divided into two different categories: Love and Rayleigh. Love waves have a particle motion, which, like the S-wave, is transverse to the direction of propagation but with no vertical motion. Their side-to-side motion (like a snake wriggling) causes the ground to twist from side to side, that's why Love waves cause the most damage to structures.

selected_spans.text: They cause the most surface destruction.
Their side-to-side motion (like a snake wriggling) causes the ground to twist from side to side, thatâs why Love waves cause the most damage to structures.

extraction: They cause the most surface destruction. Their side-to-side motion (like a snake wriggling) causes the ground to twist from side to side, that's why Love waves cause the most damage to structures.

q_text: what is a chromosomes function and purpose

The term chromosome comes from the Greek words for color (chroma) and body (soma).
